title: Alexis Sanchez injury: On-loan Man Utd forward to undergo MRI scan on 'dislocated ankle tendons'
text:
Alexis Sanchez has suffered an ankle injury with Chile (Getty Images)

Manchester United’s on-loan forward Alexis Sanchez will undergo an MRI scan with Inter to find out the extent of his ankle injury.

The 30-year-old was forced off during Chile’s 0-0 draw with Colombia on Saturday.

Chile’s FA has now confirmed that Sanchez has been released from the squad and will return to Inter for further tests after suffering damage to his left ankle.

In a statement on Sunday, Chile’s FA confirmed that Sanchez has suffered ‘dislocated ankle tendons’ but did not put a timescale on the player’s recovery.

Sanchez was forced off in the goalless draw against Colombia (EPA)

After the goalless draw against Colombia, Chile were keen to play down the extent of Sanchez’s injury.

Chile coach Reinaldo Rueda told Radio Cooperativa: ‘Alexis seems to have a suffered a small blow to the ankle.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Sanchez joined on loan Inter in the summer transfer window, with the Serie A club paying £175,000 of his £390,000-a-week salary.

The Chilean has scored one goal in four appearances for Antonio Conte’s side this season.
